poem:
**Spring Ensemble**

In line at the Sydney bakery,  
a woman in black tows the season—a calf-length  
whisper woven in wool. Her dress  
a quiet architecture, folds like whispered secrets,  
where the cowl neck softly argues  
with the spring air, her presence  
an ensemble of seams that speaks  
only of studied simplicity.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘Polished but easy’: how to dress for the office this spring A few weeks ago, standing in line at a bakery in inner Sydney, the woman in front of me was wearing such a perfect spring office outfit, I took note. A calf-length black dress with cap sleeves and a cowl neck, made in dense wool. It was architectural, twisted at the waist; fitted without being skintight, and its seams revealed it was cut on". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: ‘Polished but easy’: how to dress for the office this spring A few weeks ago, standing in line at a bakery in inner Sydney, the woman in front of me was wearing such a perfect spring office outfit, I took note. A calf-length black dress with cap sleeves and a cowl neck, made in dense wool. It was architectural, twisted at the waist; fitted without being skintight, and its seams revealed it was cut on
